intro: Tabernaemontana lactea, commonly known as the milk white star, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pink star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value but requires well-drained soil and partial shade to thrive.
